column4: Any1 know how to install Frostwire in a deb file from desktop?

sudo dpkg -i <file.deb>
2006-03-15T13:21:00.000Z	tristanmike	Neko_Freak	if it has a graphical installer replace sudo" with "gksudo"
it said need action option
what is it that you're trying to install?
sorry, did you happen to use the " that I had there ?
sorry, that was my bad, what I meant was to put another at the end, ignore the "
so it's just    sudo dpkg -i <file.deb>
do i need the <> signs?
no
usually if you see someone write that here, it mean "what's inside" same with the quotes
it said cannot access archive no such file or directory
sorry, maybe I assumed too much, type the following (you said the file was on your Desktop?)  cd ~/Desktop
how we doing there?
I got it to work finally

glad to hear. yeah, most times sudo is what you'll use, but in those rare cases where it has a graphical installer, (like Americas Army or Enemy territory) you should use gksudo or risk causing yourself headaches
I'll keep that in mind
you wouldn't know about Steam and WINE would you?
no sir, I'm sorry I don't, I have never used wine...
mmk
mkv support wasn't built in properly to the vlc package, trust me, i just spent 2 days compiling to get it to work
you have to configure mplayer in ~/.mplayer
you won't be able to get subs or change audio tracks for a file by using menus in mplayer
